[ S ] (also the grail) the cup believed to have been used by Jesus Christ at the meal before his death: King Arthur's knights Gawain, Lancelot, and Galahad were among those said to pursue the Grail. They claim that Da Vinci actually did include the grail in his painting of the Last Supper.
More examplesFewer examplesThe Grail is said to be the cup Jesus drank from at the Last Supper, or sometimes the one that caught his blood on the cross.During the thirteenth century, it came to be believed that Joseph of Arimathea had brought the Grail to Glastonbury and also that King Arthur was buried there.This is a detailed guide through the Grail's long and curious history.Motivating my students is the grail I pursue in teaching.Then I set off in search of a third gastronomic grail for the day.
[ C usually singular ] (also Grail) something that people want and are looking for but that is difficult to find or get: He has searched for his Grail of a happy family life and has finally found it. Climbing the mountain is considered to be one of the grails for ambitious mountaineers. See also
holy grail
